title: Login password guessing attack

profile.name: joola.io
profile.about: joola is an open-source project that helps businesses embed advanced analytics and visualizations as part of their website.

vulnerability_information: Your joola main login panel does not have rate limiting enabled to prevent brute force attacks on its panel
vulnerability_information_html: Your joola main login panel does not have rate limiting enabled to prevent brute force attacks on its panel

activities.message:
Thanks for your submission.

Can you please explain to which login panel you are referring to? Is it an REST authentication endpoint?

The joola team.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks for your submission.

Can you please explain to which login panel you are referring to? Is it an REST authentication endpoint?

activities.message: Yes it is the REST authentication endpoint. Please enable rate limiting on that
activities.markdown_message: Yes it is the REST authentication endpoint. Please enable rate limiting on that

activities.message:
Thank you for reporting a security vulnerability, we truly appreciate your efforts.

We have confirmed your report at this time. If your vulnerability is eligible you will be added to the wall of fame. Please be patient with us through this process.

The [joola team](http://github.com/joola/joola.io).

activities.message: Yes i will be glad and also pleased if this qualifies

activities.message:
Hi @ht_shahmeer, I can confirm the issue and open a related ticket under the main project, https://github.com/joola/joola.io/issues/486. Please feel free to add any feedback you find relevant to your ticket.

I expect the fix to go online on Monday and following that I will ask for confirmation from your side and we'll be able to close off and release to public alongside the acknowledgment of your contribution.

Thanks for your efforts.

The [joola team](http://github.com/joola/joola.io).

activities.message:
Hi @ht_shahmeer,

We are not offering any financial rewards at this time. The open-source (and poor) nature of our project does not allow it at this point in time. Maybe in the future.

Researchers who find issues which qualify (and your does) receive recognition on our [wall of fame](https://hackerone.com/joola-io/thanks) and on our wiki pages under the [Thanks section](https://github.com/joola/joola.io/wiki/Thanks).

Should our policy change in the future, I'll make sure to let you know.

Thanks,
Itay

activities.message:
Hey itay
The rate limiting should be based on account rather than IP. That would mitigate the risk effectively. The rest is fine
activities.markdown_message:
Hey itay
The rate limiting should be based on account rather than IP. That would mitigate the risk effectively. The rest is fine

activities.message:
Hi @ht_shahmeer,

We already enforce account level rate limits, please refer to the following [wiki](https://github.com/joola/joola.io/wiki/API-Documentation#rate-limits). The issue you identified is with API endpoints that are used by non-authorized users (yet), for example, the `Authenticate` endpoint. So, when using this endpoint, we don't have a user id yet, he's not authenticated. But, we should enforce rate limits nonetheless. 

So, since we already have rate limits for authenticated users, the suggestion is to limit on IP basis any open API endpoint (such as Authenticate) and limit it to 60 requests per hours. Which should prevent any real malicious threat.

Also, it might be wise to add a mechanism to allow only X number of authentication fails before being blacklisted. We already have a blacklisting protocol in place, so adding IPs to it (for a ban period) shouldn't be that difficult.

I hope it all makes sense,
Itay
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @ht_shahmeer,

We already enforce account level rate limits, please refer to the following wiki. The issue you identified is with API endpoints that are used by non-authorized users (yet), for example, the Authenticate endpoint. So, when using this endpoint, we don't have a user id yet, he's not authenticated. But, we should enforce rate limits nonetheless.

So, since we already have rate limits for authenticated users, the suggestion is to limit on IP basis any open API endpoint (such as Authenticate) and limit it to 60 requests per hours. Which should prevent any real malicious threat.

Also, it might be wise to add a mechanism to allow only X number of authentication fails before being blacklisted. We already have a blacklisting protocol in place, so adding IPs to it (for a ban period) shouldn't be that difficult.

I hope it all makes sense,
Itay

activities.message:
Hi @ht_shahmeer, 

We have released version 0.5.2 which address the issue you raised above. Full ticket and details can be found at: https://github.com/joola/joola.io/issues/486.

If you could confirm the fix is in place and that the issue raised is now resolved I'll be able to proceed with closing this ticket and adding your acknowledgment on our [wall-of-fame](http://hackerone.com/joola-io/thanks) and our [Thanks](http://github.com/joola/joola.io/wiki/thanks) page. The following text will be added to the page under the *Bug and issue identification* section. If you wish to include additional details such as your email or a link to an active profile, please let me know.

```
- ht_shahmeer via [Hacker1](https://hackerone.com/reports/12042).
```
Also, your handle @ht_shahmeer was added to the ticket header and will be included in future change-logs.

Thanks,
The [joola team](http://github.com/joola/joola.io).

If you wish to include additional details such as your email or a link to an active profile, please let me know.

Thanks,
The joola team.

activities.message:
Hi @itayw
Yes i can confirm that the end points are rate limited now and you are good to go at this. Please proceed with closing the ticket. I would like to include the name of my team in this as well. Please include below that Shahmeer Amir, Danish iqbal and Zeeshan Sultan helped in the fixing of this issue as well. And my email will be shahmeerbond@gmail.com.
Thank you.@ht_shahmeer

Thanks Shahmeer,

Please find below the suggested copy of acknowledgment on our [Thanks](http://github.com/joola/joola.io/wiki/thanks) page. 

Markdown format:
```
- [Shahmeer Amir](shahmeerbond@gmail.com), Danish iqbal and Zeeshan Sultan via [Hacker1](https://hackerone.com/reports/12042).
```
I don't know how the Thanks mechanism works for Hacker1, we'll have to find out now that I'm closing the ticket :)

Thanks,
The [joola team](http://github.com/joola/joola.io).
